description: Change of use from a dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to a small-scale House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) (Use Class C4) for up to six residents
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, number 240604-02 and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012), Part 2 (2020) and the London Plan (2021).
The small-scale House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) hereby approved shall not be occupied by more than six occupants.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of The London Plan, Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020).

The development hereby permitted, shall not be occupied until at least six cycle parking spaces are installed on the site. The cycle parking shall be designed and laid out in accordance with the London Cycling Design Standards - Paragraph 8.5.3 Residential Cycle Parking. The cycle parking facilities shall be permanently retained on the site and be kept available for ongoing use by the property's residents.

To ensure the provision and retention of facilities for cyclists in accordance with Policy T5 of The London Plan (2021), the London Cycling Design Standards, and Policy DMT 5 of Hillingdon Council's Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).
If the property subject of this application is used as a House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) and occupied by more than six persons, planning permission will be required.
